context.background: This task implements Add Monitoring and Observability Instrumentation and Runbook Notes for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 40 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Follow the PRD architecture/security conventions and keep outputs compatible with the Healio design system and response envelopes.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Add Monitoring and Observability Instrumentation and Runbook Notes in the planned files (healio/README.md, healio/lib/logger.ts, healio/app/layout.tsx, healio/sentry.server.config.ts ...) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.
Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: GET /api/v1/health) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Add or update focused tests (unit/integration) for critical business rules, idempotency, or security behavior introduced by this task.
Document assumptions and any follow-on schema/API contracts in code comments or lightweight docs when they affect downstream tasks.

validation_checklist.check: Exercise the related endpoint(s): GET /api/v1/health and verify response shape/status codes.
Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Validate security/tenant behavior with at least one negative test or rejection scenario when applicable.
Record evidence of persistence/side effects (DB row change, log entry, webhook event handling, cache behavior, etc.) as applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Add Monitoring and Observability Instrumentation and Runbook Notes is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (6.3 Sentry; 6.4 Logging & Monitoring; Vercel Analytics; UptimeRobot) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Related endpoint behavior returns the standard success/error envelope and respects auth/public route expectations for the route class.
Business rules, tenant scoping, and security constraints relevant to this task are enforced (validation, idempotency, RBAC, webhook/cron protection, etc.).
At least one verification artifact (test case, curl call, or fixture-driven check) proves the new behavior works and regressions are covered.

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; node --import tsx health route check (GET /api/v1/health)
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Added structured logging redaction and operational/health helpers, wired health endpoint to emit a dedicated observability log event, added lightweight Sentry client/server config placeholders, and injected optional frontend analytics bootstrap/script hooks in the root layout. README now includes a baseline monitoring and alerting runbook for health checks, logs, Sentry, analytics, and cron/webhook monitoring.
